action.action-desc: Mr. Cartwright (for himself and Mr. Nolan) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To enhance the early warning reporting requirements for motor vehicle manufacturers.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Early Warning Reporting System Improvement Act of 2014.
Section 30166(m) of title 49, United States Code is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking The manufacturer and inserting the following:
by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: If an incident described in clause (i) involves fatalities, the Secretary shall require the manufacturer to submit, as part of its incident report—

subclause.text: all initial claims or notice documents that notified the manufacturer of the incident;
any police reports or other documents describing or reconstructing the incident; and
any amendments or supplements to the documents described in subclause (I), except for—

item.text: property damage invoices or estimates; and

paragraph.text: in paragraph (4), by amending subparagraph (C) to read as follows:

clause.text: The information provided to the Secretary pursuant to this subsection—

subclause.text: shall be disclosed publicly unless exempt from disclosure under section 552(b) of title 5; and
shall be entered into the early warning reporting database in a manner that is searchable by manufacturer name, vehicle or equipment make and model name, model year, and type of potential defect.

clause.text: In administering this subparagraph, the Secretary shall presume in favor of maximum public availability of information.
In administering this paragraph, the confidentiality provisions under section 552(b)(4) of title 5, shall not be construed to prevent the public disclosure of—

subclause.text: production information regarding passenger motor vehicles;
information on incidents involving death or injury;
numbers of property damage claims; or

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following:
The Secretary shall consider information gathered under this section in proceedings described in sections 30118 and 30162.

section.header: Improved National Highway Traffic Safety Administration vehicle safety databases

subsection.text: Not later than 2 years after the date of the enactment of this Act, and after consultation with frequent users of its publicly available databases, the Secretary of Transportation (referred to in this section as the Secretary) shall improve public accessibility to information on the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration’s publicly accessible vehicle safety databases by—

paragraph.text: improving organization and functionality, including design features such as drop-down menus, and allowing for data from all of the publicly accessible vehicle safety databases to be searched, sorted, aggregated, and downloaded in a manner—

subparagraph.text: consistent with the public interest; and
that facilitates easy use by consumers;

paragraph.text: providing greater consistency in presentation of vehicle safety issues;

improving searchability about specific vehicles and issues through standardization of commonly used search terms and the integration of databases to enable all to be simultaneously searched using the same keyword search function; and

ensuring that all documents, studies, investigations, inspections, incident reports, and other materials related to an incident that are created or obtained by the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration be made publicly available in a manner that is searchable in databases by—

subparagraph.text: manufacturer name, vehicle or equipment make and model name, and model year;
number of injuries or fatalities; and
any other element that the Secretary determines to be in the public interest.

paragraph.text: provide public notice of all inspection and investigation activities conducted by the Secretary under section 30166 of title 49, United States Code; and
make such notices, and notice of any enforcement or other action taken as a result of an inspection or investigation—

subparagraph.text: available to consumers on the Internet immediately after such notice is issued; and
searchable by manufacturer name, vehicle or equipment make and model name, model year, system or component, and the type of inspection or investigation being conducted.
